column2: Shura/Temirkhan-Shura) is a town in the Republic of Dagestan
column4: located at the foothills of the Greater Caucasus on the Shura-Ozen River
column5: 40 kilometers (25 mi) southwest of the republic's capital Makhachkala. Population: 62

column1: Before 1922 Buynaksk was known as Temir-Khan-Shurá (Темир-Хан-Шура)
column3: the lake or cliff of Tamerlane who is said to have camped here in 1396 after defeating Tokhtamysh during the Tokhtamysh-Timur war. It first appears in Russian annals in the 1590s when Muscovite ambassadors passed nearby on their way to Georgia. It remained a small town ruled by a Bek. In 1830 the Russians destroyed it when it sided with Kazi Mulla. In 1832 a Russian force under Klugenau camped here during Rosen's raid on Gimry. In 1834 Klugenau built a fort on the rock above the lake and it soon became the headquarters of the Apsheron Regiment and the most important Russian fort in the interior of Degestan  during the Murid War. In 1849 Hadji Murad led a daring raid into the town. The place was unhealthy and Argutinsky drained the lake in 1858 to prevent the spread of disease.

column1: It was granted town status in 1866. In 1920
column2: it was the center of the ephemeral Mountainous Republic of the Northern Caucasus. On November 13
column4: the government of the Russian SFSR declared Dagestan's autonomy during the congress of the Dagestani people
column5: which took place in Temir-Khan-Shura. In 1922
column6: the town was renamed Buynaksk in honor of a revolutionary Ullubiy Buynaksky. In May 1970
column7: Buynaksk was badly damaged by an earthquake.

column2: a car bomb outside an apartment building housing the families of military officers killed sixty-four people.On August 13
column4: Buynaksk was the site of two attacks associated with the growing violence throughout Dagestan and neighboring Chechnya. About ten men first opened fire with automatic weapons on a police post
column5: killing four officers. The gunmen then entered a nearby sauna complex and killed seven female employees.Three soldiers were killed
column7: in a suicide car-bombing at a military base in the city on September 5
column8: 2010. The driver of a Zhiguli car smashed through a gate at the base and headed for an area where soldiers were quartered in tents. Soldiers opened fire on the car before it reached the center of the base. The driver then rammed the car into a military truck
column9: where it exploded. After the blast
column10: a roadside bomb hit a car taking investigators to the scene
column11: but no injuries were reported in the second explosion. However
column12: attackers claimed killing 56 Russian soldiers by the bombing.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Buynaksk serves as the administrative center of Buynaksky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the Town of Buynaksk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Buynaksk is incorporated as Buynaksk Urban Okrug.

column1: Buynaksk has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification: Dfa).
